page.title: 03DYKE VILLAGE-1985
page.content: In 1985 Dyke is still a linear village with 57 houses and a population of 155.Most houses are built of natural materials ,the newer ones blending in well with the others.It is a colourful village with well-tended gardens and many fine mature trees.Both church and school are near the centre of the village,the school having a new toilet block added and the playgrond resurfaced.Some trees were felled to extend the football field.The Muckle Burn which was famous for sea trout flows through Dyke.There are no shops but there is a haulage contracter,garden nursery,greenhouse construction and a timber merchant.There is a twice-weekly bus service to Forrres.Dyke is a quiet,peaceful village and a very pleasant place to live.There are no youth organisations except church ones
